summary:
Israel escalated its assault on Gaza City today, striking a tent in the urban centre and killing at least two children, according to local reports, as observers urged restraint and independent investigations. The attack coincides with rising diplomatic moves: Portugal plans to recognise a Palestinian state next week and the UN General Assembly voted to let Palestinian president Mahmoud Abbas address its annual gathering by video, moves that increase international attention and pressure. The combination of intensified fighting and imminent recognitions could prompt immediate diplomatic protests, emergency UN sessions, or shifts in aid access; the next step is likely urgent calls for inquiry and for parties to avoid further civilian harm.

NATO accused Russia of violating Estonian airspace; Moscow denies the claim and Estonia has requested urgent consultations, while Poland scrambled jets after strikes in western Ukraine. These incidents increase the immediate risk of miscalculation and could unsettle regional markets and energy supplies. First responders said an RSF drone strike killed 75 worshippers in El Fasher, worsening humanitarian needs, and a UN report says Iran uses drones, facial recognition and a government-backed app to enforce hijab rules, raising civil-liberties concerns. On a different note, at least 60 states have ratified a new oceans treaty that will enter into force in January, triggering new marine protections and regulatory changes.

headlines.title: Israel escalates Gaza City assault, kills children in tent strike
headlines.summary: The attack targets Gaza's urban center, with reports of casualties including at least two children; observers urge restraint and call for independent investigations.

headlines.title: NATO says Russia violates Estonia's airspace, calls it reckless
headlines.summary: NATO condemns the incursion as a threat to alliance borders and regional security; it has called for urgent talks to de-escalate tensions.

headlines.title: At least 60 states ratify oceans treaty, entering into force soon
headlines.summary: The treaty crosses the threshold after at least 60 states ratified it; it will become law in January, marking formal protection for oceans.

headlines.title: Estonia seeks NATO consultation after Russian jets violate airspace
headlines.summary: Estonia asks NATO for urgent talks after alleged Russian airspace incursions; Moscow denies entry while NATO discusses regional security and escalation risks.

headlines.title: Portugal plans to recognise a Palestinian state next week
headlines.summary: Portugal's plan to recognise a Palestinian state signals growing international support for statehood, with several other countries, including France and the UK, expected to follow next week.

headlines.title: RSF drone strike kills 75 worshippers at mosque in Darfur city
headlines.summary: First responders say 75 worshippers died as the paramilitary force advances on El Fasher; aid workers warn of humanitarian consequences.

headlines.title: UN votes to allow Palestinian president to address annual gathering via video link
headlines.summary: The UN General Assembly approves Mahmoud Abbas addressing the gathering by video link after visa restrictions, with 145 votes in favour and six abstentions.

headlines.title: Poland scrambles aircraft after Russian strikes on western Ukraine
headlines.summary: Poland and allied air forces were deployed to protect its airspace as Russia targeted western Ukraine near the border, with authorities warning of heightened risk of further strikes.

headlines.title: UN says Iran uses drones and apps to enforce hijab law
headlines.summary: The U.N. report notes Iran employs drones, facial recognition, and a government-backed app to police hijab compliance, prompting civil-liberties concerns.
